snippet: The French banking giant’s agreement to plead guilty to federal and state criminal charges and to pay an $8.9 billion penalty is a sweet windfall for the taxpayers of New York.
abstract: Agreement by French bank BNP Paribas to plead guilty to federal and state criminal charges and to pay $8.9 billion penalty is sweet windfall for taxpayers of New York, and latest in string of big settlements that have shored up state's fiscal position; New York's Financial Services Department will get $2.2 billion, and another $2.2 billion will go to Manhattan district attorney's office.

byline.original: By SUSANNE CRAIG and JAMES C. McKINLEY Jr

lead_paragraph: The French banking giant’s agreement to plead guilty to federal and state criminal charges and to pay an $8.9 billion penalty is a sweet windfall for the taxpayers of New York.

headline.main: BNP Paribas Guilty Plea Is Latest Big Settlement to Bolster New York State’s Fiscal Position
headline.print_headline: French Bank’s Guilty Plea Is Latest Big Settlement to Bolster State’s Fiscal Position
